WorkItem.ClosedComment: Most of this seems to be resolved. If you have any more problems please open a new issue.
WorkItem.Description:
I haven't had much time to play with it yet, but, even with a brief attempt, I encountered the following problems:
 
When loading the attached Rawr2 generated character (.xml) file using Safari Version 4.0.3 (5531.9) under Mac OS X Version 10.5.8, Safari either crashes and closes on load (four times), or loads, then crashes and closes on mouseover (twice).  Same character (Rhianwyn@Cenarion Circle, L80 balance druid) loads from Armory fine, except no item socket bonuses are shown; however, I should note that the ITEMS from the aborted file load now all appear to be in the cache, although not marked as available (with diamonds).
 
Under Firefox 3 (Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X 10.5; en-US; rv:1.9.1.4) Gecko/20091016 Firefox/3.5.4), the attached file loads, and can be manipulated, but no items show a socket bonus.  (Are importing socket bonuses an as-yet unimplemented feature, although the item editor allows putting them in?)
 
Other first impressions: 
  o  Interface is cleaner, and MUCH more responsive than the standalone, particularly pull-down menus, especially with WoW running.  Trying to run both the old standalone Rawr2 and WoW at once (either on my Windows XP SP3 bootcamp install, or with WoW running under OS X and Rawr2 running under Parallels/Win XP from the same install, resulted in a noticeable slowdown on both programs.
  o  Some UI elements, particularly gem graphics in the item popups, seemed somewhat slow loading and took several mouseovers before they would show correctly and consistantly.
  o  Really, REALLY missing the 'Reload Current Character from Armory' menu function (not yet implemented), probably one of my more used commands in the program (the easiest way to bring in new items marked as available without unmarking the old ones).
  o  Is there some way of accessing a master item cache yet like Rawr2 had for evaluating potential upgrades (other than loading a fresh character or entering them by hand), that I'm missing, or is that a not-yet-implemented feature?
 
Like it so far.
 
Rhianwyn/Redwuff
 
My main system:
 
  Model Name:	MacBook Pro
  Model Identifier:	MacBookPro4,1
  Processor Name:	Intel Core 2 Duo
  Processor Speed:	2.6 GHz
  Number Of Processors:	1
  Total Number Of Cores:	2
  L2 Cache:	6 MB
  Memory:	4 GB  667 MHz DDR2 SDRAM
  Bus Speed:	800 MHz
  Boot ROM Version:	MBP41.00C1.B03
  SMC Version (system):	1.28f2
 
  Video: GeForce 8600M GT, 512MB vram, running at 1920x1200 32 bit
 
  System Version:	Mac OS X 10.5.8 (9L31a)
  Kernel Version:	Darwin 9.8.0
 
  Safari and Firefox3 versions listed above.  Using a freshly reinstalled version of Silverlight.
WorkItem.Summary: [Base] Problems with Rawr2 character files under OS X (and first impressions)

Comments.Message:
Not always getting mouseover tooltips is kind of a big deal. Running standalone on Mac OS X with Silverlight all updated and whatnot.

Click on an item, get a big long list of names of items, but no mouseover tooltip on the gems or item itself.
Also having trouble getting ArPen gemming to show as an option, but maybe that's just me being a bit technologically challenged.

Not seeing an easy, intuitive way to get it to optimize me with a Nightmare Tear in a suitable blue socket with a good socket bonus (Feral DPS druid).

Occasionally when hitting a drop-down menu the tooltip from a nearby item will block my view of what's in the menu.
mousover tooltips buggy on Upgrades list too, I have to click the green diamond to get it to pop up
would love a simple right-click-select-do not display this item-feature in upgrades list, as there's no chance in hell I'm going to worry about getting some super-mega arena pvp weapons

Feral Cat.

Upgrade list is telling me to gem the 245 Lupine Longstaff with a +20 Str Bold Cardinal Ruby.
Main "Gems" window is telling me Bold Cardinal Ruby is right behind Nightmare Tear for dps.
Main Hand window is telling me 245 Lupine Longstaff with a +20 Agi Delicate Cardinal Ruby.
Relative Stat Values is telling me Agility outweighs Str.
Unable to find a way to select having a Nightmare Tear in 258 Leggings of the Broken Beast.
